editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Fellows of Merton College .

msDesc.head: BONAVENTURE ON I SENT.; S. XIII2

msItem.note: At the head of fol. i is ‘Bonauenture super .1. librum Sen.’, s. xiv; fols. iv-ii blank.

msItem.author: BONAVENTURE
msItem.title: Commentary on I Sent.
msItem.incipit: Profunda fluuiorum scrutatus est et abscondita produxit in lucem. Verbum istud sumptum est ex Iob xxviii
msItem.explicit: secundum uirtutem que operatur in nobis ipsi gloria in ecclesia et in Christo Iesu in omnes generationes s. s. amen.
msItem.note: On fol. 106v are very faint pencil notes.
BO 1; Distelbrink 2; Glorieux, Théol. 305b; Stegmüller, Sent. 111. Annotated in early anglicana hands, mostly in pencil.

msItem.title: Table of distinctiones and problemata in Bonaventure on III Sent.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit problemata super tertium sententiarum. Continet problemata 299 preter questiones incidentes et questiones literales.
msItem.note: On fol. 109v are philosophical notes in a small early anglicana hand and others in pencil.
fols. 109–10v blank but for the remains of an early note at the head of 110v.

supportDesc.extent:
112 leaves (ii + 110) 330 225
230 160
The edges retrimmed affecting running heads and marginalia, and spattered with red. Fols. i-ii, 109–10 are of thick, stiff parchment.
supportDesc.collation: A bifolium at each end, 1–912; catchwords.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with pencil in 2 cols. of 63 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A proficient small English gothic rotunda bookhand.

decoDesc.decoNote: On fol. 1 is a flourished red and blue initial with 1-sided border; red or blue initials flourished in the other colour; red or blue paraphs, underlining in red.

binding.p: Standard Merton s. xvii; sewn on five bands; formerly chained from the usual position. On fol. i is the mark of a brass chain-staple near the foot of the foredge. The outermost leaves were pastedowns in an earlier binding.

history.provenance: On fol. i ‘Liber domus scolarium de Merton ex tradicione Bernard’ pro Hugucione’, s. xiv, repeated on fol. iivin a hand of s. xvii. This must refer to Thomas Bernard (BRUO 179), fellow in 1322–3 and 1346: UO47. 142, ‘in libraria’.
Lower down is ‘Caucio M. [erased] pro ii s.’, s. xiv.
At the foot of fol. 85 a pen trial ofc.1500 includes the name ‘Ric’ Borstalle’ (perhaps the Borstalle who wrote Bodl. Libr., Lat. misc. d. 53).

At the head of fol. 1 is the James no. ‘30’ (but this is MS 116), s. xvii in. Inside the front board is a sheet of paper with a title, s. xvii, and ‘O. 1. 8. Art:’, canc. and replaced with ‘L. 2. 7 (CXIV)’ in red; the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.

availability.p: For enquiries relating to this manuscript please contact Merton College Library.
